meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before a reform.
meanings.sent2: The school board discussed the prereform curriculum.
meanings.sent3: The prereform rules seemed like ancient relics.
meanings.sent4: Her house was a prereform time capsule.
meanings.sent5: The prereform era felt like a distant memory.

meanings.definition: To reform or change something before it is implemented.
meanings.sent1: They prereform the system to avoid future issues.
meanings.sent2: She always prereforms her strategies for better results.
meanings.sent3: He prereforms his room layout every month for fun.
meanings.sent4: The team prereformed their approach to the project.
meanings.sent5: Prereforming the process saved them time and effort.
